The extra's seem sparse but I think the documentary should be good.

I do hope they have unique interesting clips of Bobby and not stuff that can be found simply on other previous DVD releases. I look forward to this DVD and I do hope they have much more recent video of Bobby.

reviewText: Many have called him the greatest wrestling manager of all time while others have taken it a step further & called him the greatest entertainer of all time.  Either way, he's one name that is legendary in all aspects of the business from managing to commentary to just being on the greatest on the mic...they don't call him "The Brain" for no reason as WWE gives us a look into the career of Bobby Heenan.  Now I have to point out before you read any further that you do NOT hear from Bobby Heenan on the documentary (which is probably due to his health issues) and the interview segments featuring him in the extras were from past interviews.  However you do hear old & new comments from his family (wife Cindi & daughter Jessica), his peers (Larry "The Ax" Hennig, Baron Von Rashke, Blackjack Mulligan, Ken Patera, Greg Gagne, Dusty Rhodes, Nick Bockwinkle, Ricky Steamboat, Vince McMahon, Arn Anderson, Brooklyn Brawler, Pat Patterson, Jerry Lawler, Michael Hayes, Jim Cornette, Harvey Whippleman, Jim Brunzel) & current superstars (Matt Striker, John Cena, Joey Styles, Dolph Ziggler).The documentary stars talking about his roots in Chicago without his father, working to support his family, and how where he worked got him into the wrestling business.  His managing roots in the AWA is covered talking about his alliances with The Blackjacks along with Nick Bockwinkle & Ray Stevens before going into what made him a notorious heel to the point where a fan once attempted to shoot him at a show.  The story behind the birth of the weasel suit was talked about before going into his decision to leave the AWA for the WWE.  How he ended up managing Big John Studd in his WWE debut was mentioned before going into his ability as a manager to help his talents along with being the manager who didn't mind taking bumps & getting beat up.  His important roles at WrestleMania I & III (they didn't mention II with Bundy) & the significance of him being a "weasel" were discussed before going into how Bobby was a manager of champions with the title reigns of various members of his family.  Bobby's time on Prime Time Wrestling with Heenan having the ability to talk & entertain while also growing a close relationship with Gorilla Monsoon complete with various highlights from the show before going into the story of him having the last half hour for his own show, "The Bobby Heenan Show."  How Bobby was able to transition from a manager into full time commentator was discussed along with his ability to be diverse & the chemistry with Gorilla Monsoon.  His reasons for leaving WWE, the story behind how he ended up in WCW shortly afterwords & being unhappy during his stay there, his health issues with throat cancer, and entering the WWE Hall Of Fame conclude the documentary.Various Matches Include:w/Nick Bockwinkel vs. Hulk Hogan - This is advertised as a handicap match but don't let the title fool as you this was more like "Hulk Hogan vs. Nick Bockwinkle featuring Bobby Heenan" as Heenan really only got involved to do his entertaining comedic spots & act like the "weasel" we all know him to be while Hogan & Bockwinkle had a good match.AWA May '81[Hulk Hogan's Unreleased Collectors' Series]Weasel Suit Match vs. Ultimate Warrior - AWA legend The Crusher was the special guest ring announcer for this match.  This was mostly a dominate performance by Warrior with Heenan trying to keep running away & with his only offense resorting to using a foreign object to get an advantage.  The payoff here though was Bobby being so entertaining in his weasel suit.WrestleFest `88Royal Rumble Battle Royal - Bobby did commentary on this match along with Gorilla Monsoon.  This was one of the most entertaining Rumbles with Bobby Heenan reacting to Flair's every move on commentary leaving for the classic back & forth verbal battles from Monsoon & Heenan along with Bobby making comments towards wrestlers like when Roddy Piper saved Flair from a beat down saying "Thank you Roddy!  It's a kilt, not a dress!" only to see Piper attack Flair afterwords causing Heenan to off of in a rant "You No Good Freak!  YOU SKIRT WEARING FREAK!"  Other highlights of this Rumble include the first appearance of Shawn Michaels under his "Heartbreak Kid" persona, Randy Savage getting his hands on Jake Roberts, the Hogan/Sid confrontation, and Ric Flair being awarded the WWE Championship afterwords.Royal Rumble '92[Ultimate Ric Flair Collection]Gimmick Battle Royal - Bobby did commentary here along with Gene Okerland as this was both men's first appearances in WWE since leaving in 1993.  The battle royal itself was pretty quick as the highlights were just seeing all the names from the past along with both Bobby & Gene having fun during the entrances at the expense the wrestlers such as remembering Gene's encounter with the Gookleygooker, Heenan's remark towards Iron Sheik "It will be WrestleMania 28 by the time he gets to the ring", and the fun they were having with other such as when the Bushwackers licked Gene's hair ("What You Got Left...Both Of Them").  This was just classic Heenan & Okerland.WrestleMania X7Other matches include a mangers match vs. Lord Alfred Hayes, Greg Gagne in a weasel suit match, and Salvatore Bellomo from "MSG."  Other DVD extras include interviews featuring Bobby Heenan talking about the first group he managed & an outtake of him joking around with his wife, his daughter talking about the OTHER weasel suit & her Dad's involvement at her wedding & what she did after appearing on TV to make Vince tell her "your definitely Bobby's daughter", Baron Von Rashke talking about Bobby having to wrestle a bear, Nick Bockwinkle telling a story about a prank Bobby pulled on an announcer during a live interview, Bobby receiving the Manager Of The Year Award in 1976, his first TNT appearance, a trip with Gorilla Monsoon to Busch Gardens, Gene Okerland giving him golf tips, Bobby's entrance at WrestleMania IX, Gorilla Monsoon kicking Heenan out of the WWE, Bobby saying his farewell to Monsoon on Nitro, Johnathan Coachman catching him backstage at WrestleMania XX, highlights of his various comedic moments, and his complete 2004 Hall Of Fame induction (I was laughing so hard when he went off about the World Wildlife Fund).I have to say that the documentary was a bit disappointing with Bobby not speaking during it along with the fact that it ran just under an hour (never really went into the specifics of anything) but the bonus extras heavily made up for it while the matches with Bobby as a wrestler were just as good as you would expect which is why it was a nice bonus that they threw in the Royal Rumble & Gimmick Battle Royal matches.  The only things I wish they would have added would have been highlights from him & Monsoon at the shooting of the western movie while mentioning the fact that he was put on the John Madden All-Madden Team.  Overall, it's a good retrospective of one of the greatest wrestling personalities of all time that I would get.
summary: One Of The Greatest Entertainers In Wrestling History

reviewText: BOBBY THE BRAIN HEENANIf you are a wrestling fan at all then I think it is impossible for you to not know who this man is. Sure maybe you  are a youngen or something a true fan learns about the greats, even if they were before your time. Any way Bobby Heenan is a true legend in this sport and is a true Hall of Famer. If any body ever deserved a documentary made about them from the WWE it is indeed this man.He has been called the greatest manager ever, greatest commenter ever, and even greatest entertainer ever, what ever you want to call him he is still a legend. This I must say is a great set basically because of who it is about, even though like many other reviews have said the Documentary is lacking a little it is still fun. Sure it would have been great to hear from the man himself but he does have health issues, so since all the classic Heenan moments are here I will forgive the Doc shortcomings. Along with the matches and such you get on here there are also all kinds of other goodies like interviews and sure here as special features.Spoilers1.BOBBY HEENAN VS LORD ALFRED HAYES-this is actually a very good match between these two. It is very entertaining with both doing very well, Hayes is flashy with his style here. The match is a good back and forth battle that the fans were very into. Hayes uses the ropes to get the pin fall but Heenan nails not only Hayes but the ref as well with a chair. This is the first match from the AWA matches on the disc.2.[WEASEL SUIT MATCH]BOBBY HEENAN VS GREG GAGNE-another good match that proves Heenan was a great entertainer. Gagne of course wins this as any one could guess so Heenan has to wear the weasel suit. It is great when he wakes up and realizes what happened, the crowd is so into it. This of course is another AWA match and one of Heenan's classic moments.3.BOBBY HEENAN & NICK BOCKWINKEL VS HULK HOGAN-this handicapped match in the AWA was like the previous two an entertaining one. They both jump all over Hogan here but of course Hulk wins this one regardless. I was never a Hogan fan but still the match was fun and great to see.4.BOBBY HEENAN VS SALVATORE BELLOMO-good to hear Gorilla Monson and Lord Alfred Hayes on commentary during this match. This of course is the first of the WWF matches and as always Bobby is very entertaining. Heenan actually does pretty good in this match putting in some offense. He even actually gets the win after he holds the rope to block a sunset flip attempt.5.[WEASEL SUIT MATCH]BOBBY HEENAN VS ULTIMATE WARRIOR-The Crusher was the special guest ring announcer for this one right here. This match was all Warrior as he dominated Heenan when he would get his hands on him. Of course Bobby ran as much as possible but the match didn't last to long. His reaction when he wakes up and realizes the suit is on is priceless, I love it.6.1992 ROYAL RUMBLE-possibly the best Rumble match of all time with Bobby and Gorilla on the commentary, classic. Of course the story here was Ric Flair trying to prove he was the real World Champion after leaving WCW. In this Rumble the winner would not get a shot at the champ at Wrestlemania, the winner would be crowned the new WWF Champion. The action here is great with Flair outlasting everyone to become champion but it was great to HBK and Randy Savage in this since they are my favorites of all time. Also I remember when we were watching this when it was live back in 92 on PPV it proved my point about Hulk Hogan. At the end of this Rumble he is thrown over the top by Sid Vicious cleanly, he of course can not stand that he was eliminated and cheats. He grabs onto Sid and holds him until Sid is eliminated, I remember thinking it is every man for himself and he was thrown over the top. Man I have never been a fan of Hogan.7.GIMMICK BATTLE ROYAL-this was a fun one because you got to see all these old guys come back, plus Bobby and Mene Gene were on the mic. It was cool to see the Bushwackers, Doink, and The Goon [I love Hockey] back but I loved seeing Repo Man back. The match is quick as bodies start to fly out every where and the Iron Sheik wins this one; it was a cool battle royal.Bobby is and will always be a legend in wrestling and is probably the greatest manager of all time and may be the best commentator as well.

reviewText: Other reviewers here have said that this disc is a quick money maker by the WWE, and I can see why, but it's really not something to give low ratings to. Sure, like any other WWE video, you just want more, like I know a lot of us would love to have seen more of the days of Bobby and Gorilla Monsoon's antics on their intro shows, and even the Bobby Heenan show itself (which disapointgly this 2 disc set does not include any shows in the bonus contents) but for what it is, it's not so bad, and does recapture some of the great and hilarious moments of the man who definitively is the greatest manager in Wrestling history, and possibly even the best color commentator in wrestling, depending on who you ask, but even as said in this DVD, there is not really anyone around who did not love Bobby Heenan, or had a bad thing to say about him. He is a legend in Wrestling, and someone we all wish the WWE would bring back, but it's probably something Vince McMahon has attempted to do, but Bobby's personal life and not wanting to be on such a hectic schedule keep him from returning.One thing I must say that I really did not like about this whole thing, and why so many others have given this a bad review, is the fact that the whole thing does not include the man himself in interviews, and instead interviews his gorgeous daughter who talks in the interview like her father died. I keep hearing "Bobby was..."from a lot of the interviewees and getting the impression that Bobby has passed on. This is not the case, Bobby is alive, to date of this review, and seeing as how he has not been seen since 2007, it really makes you wonder why the heck he is not involved with this DVD?The bonus content has some of the highlights from Heenans career, both as a manager and a wrestler. The infamous "weasel" matches are included, as well as some early day matched/managing and stunts, and the entire 1992? Royal Rumble, which was a nice walk down memory lane for me, tho if you weren't even around in those days, and have no desire to see it, then it's irrelevant to you.The feature goes for just under an hour, and then there is about 2 hours or more of bonus material. For the price it is, it's a decent buy, if you are skeptical, try renting it or D/L it, but for those who miss Bobby Heenan in the WWF days, then this a great opportunity to relive some of the memories, and discover a few new ones. As usual, the WCW content is pretty short, it mentions more of what went wrong rather then the highlights, or wrongful highlights I should say, like when Bobby cussed on air at Brian Pillman. That footage is not seen anywhere on this DVD release. But a lot of other highlights from the career of "The Brain" is.It's decent and OK, you will want more, but for what it is, it's definitely not a 1 or 2 star release.
summary: Decent... but as usual, leaves fans screaming for more.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is definitely a "could have been" DVD set. Given Heenan's fabulous and diverse career, there was plenty of material to draw upon to tell his story. However, the documentary portion of disc one is woefully short. Sure, there are some special features that are humorous, but there should have been more detail paid to the documentary of his career. Disc two, the matches, are not exactly the greatest selections. Many have already been part of other sets, particularly the WrestleMania related selections. Realistically, this DVD could have been up there with Jericho's DVD as one of the best of 2010, but falls well short of its true potential.
summary: Could Have Been so Much More
